parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> ofp </value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Unit Identity </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr2</name>=<value> Locations </value></part><part><name>GROUP2</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> When argument is [[Object]], the command returns the name given to a unit using the [[setIdentity]] instruction or selected randomly by the game engine if [[setIdentity]] has not been used on the unit. If used on vehicle, name of first crew member (in order commander, driver, gunner). If used on an object, "Error: No unit" is being returned.<br>
When argument is [[Location]], the location's name is returned. To return the textual value of a location use [[text]] command instead.<br><br>
<template lineStart="1"><title>Feature arma3 </title><part><name index="1"/><value> [[setName]] can be used on a person to set [[name]]. However in multiplayer [[name]] always returns [[profileName]].</value></part></template></value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> [[name]] object </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> object: [[Object]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[String]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>s2</name>=<value> [[name]] location </value></part><part><name>Alternative syntax</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p21</name>=<value> location: [[Location]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER2</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>r2</name>=<value> [[String]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE2</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_name = [[name]] [[player]];</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>_locationName = [[name]] myLocation;</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE2</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>x3</name>=<value> <code>[[name]] [[nearestLocation]] [<ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/></ext>[[position]] [[player]], "Hill"]; <template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>""</value></part></template>
[[text]] [[nearestLocation]] [<ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/></ext>[[position]] [[player]], "Hill"]; <template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>"Lesnoy Khrebet"</value></part></template></code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE3</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[profileName]], [[setName]], [[nameSound]], [[setNameSound]], [[createLocation]], [[deleteLocation]], [[drawLocation]], [[locationPosition]], [[locationNull]], [[nearestLocation]], [[nearestLocations]], [[nearestLocationWithDubbing]]</value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value>
</value></part></template>

<h3 style="display:none">Notes</h3>
<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment>
<dt class="note">[[User:kju|kju]]
<dd class="note">[[Location]] variant appears to be only for the 3d editor.

<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>
<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment>
<dd class="notedate">Posted on August 4, 2006 - 10:56
<dt class="note">[[User:Hardrock|hardrock]]
<dd class="note">''Notes from before the conversion:''

Name will return an error for units that have been dead for more than a few seconds.

<dd class="notedate">Posted on December 15, 2006 - 05:27
<dt class="note">[[User:Kronzky|Kronzky]]
<dd class="note">To return the name of the unit that was given in the editor's "name" field, call up the unit's object in a format statement: 
<code>[[hint]] [[format]] ["Unit's name: %1", _unitobject];</code>

<dd class="notedate">Posted on April 14, 2009
<dt class="note">[[User:Alef|alef]]
<dd class="note">Will return <tt>Error: No vehicle</tt> for [[JIP]] players in [[init.sqf]], if no [[sleep]] were performed
<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>
